metadata.title: CVE-2020-25668 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in Linux Kernel because access to the global variablefg_console is not properly synchronized leading to a use after free incon_font_op.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25668` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-198-generic - 4.4.0-198.230
linux-image-4.4.0-198-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-198.230
linux-image-4.4.0-198-lowlatency - 4.4.0-198.230
linux-image-4.4.0-198-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-198.230
linux-image-4.4.0-198-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-198.230
linux-image-4.4.0-198-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-198.230
linux-image-4.4.0-198-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-198.230
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-198-generic - 4.4.0-198.230
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-198-lowlatency - 4.4.0-198.230
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-129-generic - 4.15.0-129.132~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-129-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-129.132~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-129-lowlatency - 4.15.0-129.132~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-129-generic - 4.15.0-129.132~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-129-lowlatency - 4.15.0-129.132~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1085-kvm - 4.4.0-1085.94
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1119-aws - 4.4.0-1119.133
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1091-aws - 4.15.0-1091.96~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1103-azure - 4.15.0-1103.114~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1091-gcp - 4.15.0-1091.104~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1062-oracle - 4.15.0-1062.68~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1143-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1143.153
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1147-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1147.157
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-198.230').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-129.132~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1085.94').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1119.133').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1091.96~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1103.114~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1091.104~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1062.68~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1143.153').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1147.157').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1074.80').
